TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SoapBindingStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of action that occurs in the XML Web service at the level of the class hierarchy to which this enumeration is applied.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration allows the user to specify whether the message being transmitted is procedure-oriented or document-oriented. Procedure-oriented messages contain parameters and return values, while document-oriented messages contain documents.
## Examples [!code-cs[SoapBinding_SoapOperationBinding#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_31_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[SoapBinding_SoapOperationBinding#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_31_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[SoapBinding_SoapOperationBinding#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_31_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingStyle Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The default type of action for the current hierarchical level of the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingStyle Document = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The message being transmitted is document-oriented.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Services.Description.SoapBindingStyle Rpc = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The message being transmitted contains the parameters to call a procedure or the return values from that procedure. RPC is an acronym for "remote procedure call."
